Ingredients.10: 8 slices bread, cut in half diagonally

Directions.1: Preheat an oven to 100 degrees F ( 40 degrees C).

Directions.2: Heat mashed strawberries and 1/2 cup white sugar in a saucepan over medium heat.

Directions.3: Mix cornstarch and water together in a bowl, then stir into the strawberries.

Directions.4: Cook and stir until thickened, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer while preparing remaining ingredients, stirring occasionally.

Directions.5: Whisk together the milk and eggs in a bowl; set aside.

Directions.6: Mash cream cheese, vanilla extract, and 3/4 cup white sugar in a bowl until smooth.

Directions.7: Spread the cream cheese mixture over a triangle-shaped piece of bread, and top with another piece. Repeat with remaining bread and cream cheese mixture to make 8 triangle-shaped sandwiches.

Directions.8: Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat.

Directions.9: Dip the sandwiches into the egg mixture, 2 or 3 at a time, and place in the skillet.

Directions.10: Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.

Directions.11: Transfer pan-fried sandwiches to a baking sheet and place in the preheated oven to keep warm while cooking remaining sandwiches.

Directions.12: To serve, top French toast with warm strawberry glaze and sliced fresh strawberries and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.
